reviewText: 1. Be Deviled--Hercules meets Sin (who is responsible for the souls of those who are too bad even for Tartarus and who looks just like Serena). She has released Xerxos to help her catch Hercules who she wants in her realm. Xerxos wants to see his sister Arciana who is looking for the sword of Hera. Sin and Hercules combine forces in order to catch Xerxos. *2. Love, Amazon Style--Aphrodite and Hephaestus have split up and causing Aphrodite's powers to go a little haywire. To liven things up, Aphrodite has the man- hating Amazons waiting hand and foot on the men of the village. Deimos is using the Amazons to look for the Chronos Stone which would give him more power than Zeus.3. Rebel with a Cause--Hercules arrives in Thebas to discover Oedipus is no longer king. Oedipus is upset because he discovered that his wife is also his mother. Creon, Oedipus' brother, has stolen the throne from Oedipus.  Antigone is the only hope to restore peace to Thebas as she is the rightful heir.4. Darkness Visible--Hercules is summoned to Dacia to help his old comrade, Prince Vlad to fight the Strigoi (vampires). Galen goes along to look for his sister. Hercules discovers that Vlad has been turned into a vampire. Hercules must kill Vlad in order to restore all the other Strigoi to humans.5. Hercules, Tramps, & Thieves-- Autolycus is accused of robbing the first bank of Greece. The real culprit is his ex-wife Luscious Deluxe.6. City of the Dead--Hercules and Iolaus travel to Egypt as emissaries of peace and find Queen Nefertiti is being plotted against. Ramses is arrested for high treason.7. A Wicked Good Time--Lilith's and Jason's daughter, Seska, has graduated the Academy and is having a hard time adjusting.  Discord is creating a coven of witches and recruits the unhappy Seska.  Hercules is put on trial for being a warlock.8. Full Circle--Hercules and Iolaus pay Nemesis a visit and discover Zeus has taken Evander away from her.  Hercules teaches Evander how to help people with his powers instead of being destructive. Zeus uses Evander to release Hera from the Abyss of Tartarus where Hercules has sent her because he misses her. He also releases the Titan from the Abyss.  Ares helps the Titans release Atlas (their brother) so they can destroy Olympus.
Title: N/A

reviewText: There were a few memorable episodes from Herc season 6.  Bedeviled was one of my favorites, and Full Circle was ok.  Although I wish it had been a bit more serious.  I wish they had given Herc a two part series finale send off.  And it would have been nice to see a sequel to Bedeviled too.  I think Michael should have showed up again, but the guy was probably filming some Xena eps.  Still, would have been nice to see him helping Herc out a bit.  I also liked Darkness Visible.  Herc against vampires.  Very cool!  The other five sort of slip my mind at the moment.  It was a good season, but I wish they'd have made it longer!

reviewText: It truly was great knowing that they gave the show half a season more to properly wrap up loose ends.  But originally when this set was released on dvd, the cost was ridiculous.  Only eight episodes in a five disc package?!  Talk about overkill!  But they knew that the devoted fans would buy it regardless.  Great show, but like everyone else I wish there were more episodes in the last season.

reviewText: There is no real reason why this final season of "Hercules" should have been made, except to serve as a farewell to the characters that we came to know and love over the previous five seasons of its airing. This season only comprises eight episodes, with no continuing storyline to hold them together, but which serve to allow viewers to see some of their series favourites one last time. Episodes in this season feature appearances by Autolycus (Bruce Campbell), Aphrodite (Alexandra Tydings) and Ares (Kevin Smith), although Salmoneous, Morrigan and Nebula are all, sadly, missing.The storylines of the episodes aren't bad, with all of them being average or above average. The stand-out best episode is one in which Autolycus runs into his ex-wife, Luscious Deluxe (Traci Lords), and gets accused of robbing the First National Bank of Greece. Other story lines include a story about vampire; one set in Egypt and featuring Queen Nephritite; and a rip-off of "The Craft". The final episode itself was probably my least favourite of the season. This episode focuses on Hercules and his relationship with Zeus and Hera, and it is let down by a lot of bad-acting and a dodgy, overly sentimental, script. Still, it least it's a better finale than that of "Xena".Overall, I finished watching this season of "Hercules" with a feeling of satisfaction. I didn't regret watching these episodes and having seen them, I was left with a feeling of wanting more, but more in the sense that I wanted to go back and re-watch the earlier episodes, not in the sense that I want to see more episodes made, and that's the best way for any TV series to end.

reviewText: Love how the actors and crew all went into season 6 knowing that this last 8 episodes were going to be the last so they just went into season 6 having fun, doing funny things, stupid things. they had fun in these last episodes and it shows in their performances. The series finale was one of the most comedy filled of the series in my opinion and from what i heard it's because they new it was the last and just wanted to go out with a smile and it also put a smile on my face.season 6 a great ending to one of the best tv shows in the history of tv in my opinion
summary: Loved how they just had fun with the ending

reviewText: Hercules:Legendary Journeys is one of the best fantasy series EVER. Xena:Warrior Princess still gets my vote as being THE best, however. Hercules, Ares, Zeus, Hera, and others are all featured in this series. Xena was more tough and gritty. Hercules, although tough, also added in occasional, gut-wrenching comedy that will leave you laughing on the floor! Do not let that fool you though. Hercules was all about kickin' rear and takin' names when he had to. Highly versatile actor is Kevin Sorbo(Hercules, Xena, Andromeda, recently Hawaii Five O) and very talented on camera. One other thing although maybe not the most professional thing to mention. THE WOMEN ON THIS SERIES ARE GORGEOUS. I MEAN...GORGEOUS. Why the actress who played Aphrodite has not been seen much after this sries is a crime against humanity. A low down, dirty, rotten shame. Easly the most attractive woman I have seen in the past 20 years on TV. I mean it. If you like fantasy(Beastmaster, Conan, etc.) action, this is easily a must-have for your collection! Buy it!

reviewText: The entire Hercules series was a slapstick, wacky and wonderfully serious (at times) portrayal of one of the world's greatest legends. This show is just super for all ages and while the fight scenes get a little old, they're still fun to watch because they put a lot of subtle comedy into each and every episode. Hercules offers us insights and layers of relevant issues in any time, plus a whole lot of fun. Good beats evil. Right beats wrong. Any questions?
summary: Fabulous - a must for your collection

reviewText: I wondered why Season Six had only 8 episodes.  They were only planning 4 movies for Hercules, then they decided to do one more movie which lead into the tv series.  Then came Xena, a spinoff, and they planned on having only 5 seasons of Hercules.  They wanted to end the series right with a good ending so they did a 6th season with very few episodes, which is why their is so few of them unlike Xena.  This season has many good episodes, and thier isn't many bad ones.  Out of the 8, thier was maybe one or two that weren't the best.  The final episode is the reason why you should get this, it's just so funny and it ends it right, by tying everything back together the way it should have from the start.  The DvD set keeps getting smaller too.  Out of the hercules six seasons, their are three different sizes which make it look weird, but the show makes up for that.  If hercules never got their show, we wouoldn't ever have the show Xena.  It was Destiny!
